intro: Tephrosia filipes subsp. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with elongated leaflets and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. Its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses make it a noteworthy species in botanical studies.
